explanation: The report is correct. strncpy(fd_prop->Path, record->name_entry, sizeof(fd_prop->Path) - 1) will attempt to read up to (sizeof(fd_prop->Path)-1) bytes from record->name_entry regardless of whether that object actually contains a NUL within that range or is allocated that large. Nothing in the shown code (or the provided surrounding definitions) guarantees that record->name_entry points to a buffer at least that large or that it is NUL-terminated within that limit. Hence the call can cause reads beyond the bounds of the source object, which violates MISRA C 2023 Rule 21.17. Recommended fixes include ensuring record->name_entry is a pointer to a buffer of known and sufficient size (or converting it to a fixed-size array), copying only the known-valid length (from an associated length field), or otherwise ensuring the source buffer is NUL-terminated within the destination limit before calling strncpy.
